primaryIntroduction.title: A short introduction at the beginning of the development for this platform jhipster.de:
p_1: This jhipster-Application is connected to this GitHub-Repository
and build after successful testing with a Jenkins-Server (connecting to the docker-server-local 'docker.sock') as '*.war'-file
and docker-image and transferred to a docker-registry.
Then Jenkins triggers a following task to connect to the docker-server and call some docker- and docker-compose commands to pull the new image
and rebuild and rerun the docker-container. This container offers his services here behind a nginx-proxy and nginx-proxy-companion running in some other
docker-containers. It is also connected to a postgresql-docker-container with a docker-network.
The postgresql-container persists the applications data. In project changes the database can be migrated with liquibase.
p_2: You can find the server-side docker-configuration of one of my servers here.
I hope, I have internalized the advantages of 'Convention-over-Configuration'-principles at this point to be able to offer preferably open-source
work on every layer on the one hand and did not compromise my server security on the other hand.
p_3: I advert to numerous ingenious and apparent unremittingly minds who enable me to be acquainted with the hippest techniques over which I was stumbling in my last twenty years (plus) of work experience
- free to use and with a lot of help to learn.
p_4:
I want to start with a small collection of references which brought me to jhipster.de:
(in this early state of development here at the index page)
li_1: all outstanding techniques and their master craftsmen behind www.jhipster.tech
li_2: to which are included amongst many others Julien Dubois,
Deepu K Sasidharan and Matt Raible
li_3: the helpful as well as detailed introduction <a href="https://www.packtpub.com/application-development/full-stack-development-jhipster" target="_blank">Full
Stack Development with JHipster by Sasidharan
li_4: the evermore kept up to date book by Raible JHipster Mini-Book
li_5: the very dedicated Courses by John Thompson to the Spring framework, Spring Boot and many techniques connected to them to be found in
li_6: the company GENERICA GmbH, which gave me the possibility to change my IT-business back to something enjoyable bit by bit
li_7: Yuval Noah Harari and his books
Eine kurze Geschichte der Menschheit and
Homo Deus - Eine Geschichte von Morgen
li_9: Marc Elsberg and his books 'Blackout', 'Zero' und 'Helix'
li_10: the youtube-channel Urknall, Weltall und Leben and the accompanying website
urknall-weltall-leben.de by Prof. Joseph Gassner and Prof. Harald Lesch
li_11: the at the channel in many hours created playlist <a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmDf0YliVUvGGAE-3CbIEoJM3DJHAaRzj" target="_blank">Von
li_13: my beloved wife Marina who makes a better human out of me - the human I like to be. In the main thing forever at her side!
li_14: my parents who donated me my first computer for confirmation, an Atari Mega ST. And of course a lot of 'things' more...
li_15: my good friends at F.o.B. and all my other good friends!
p_5: Open Source is the only way in an useful future of IT.
